laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT ABD & PELVIS W & W/O CONTRAST, ADDL SECTIONS

findings.lower_chest: Dependent atelectasis is mild. No focal opacities in the partially imaged lower lungs. No evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.

abdomen.hepatobiliary: Background liver parenchyma is normal. An 10-mm hypodense lesion in hepatic segment 8 likely a cyst. No concerning focal hepatic lesion. No evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation.
abdomen.pancreas: The pancreas has normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
abdomen.spleen: The spleen shows normal size and attenuation throughout.
abdomen.adrenals: The right and left adrenal glands are normal in size and shape.
abdomen.urinary: The kidneys are of normal and symmetric size. No renal stones or focal renal masses. Mild fullness of the right renal pelvis.
abdomen.gastrointestinal: The appendix is dilated up to 15 mm with moderate fat stranding. The terminal ileum is fluid-filled and mildly distended.
abdomen.pelvis: No free fluid in the pelvis.
abdomen.reproductive_organs: The prostate gland contains coarse central calcifications, likely the sequela of prior inflammation.
abdomen.lymph_nodes: Scattered mesenteric lymph nodes are probably reactive.
abdomen.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Mild atherosclerotic disease noted.
abdomen.bones: No acute fracture. No osseous lesions concerning for malignancy.
abdomen.soft_tissues: The abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.
